course_title: Diagnostics and Clinical Reasoning: Women¿s Health Gender Related Care
course_description: This course focuses on the delivery of primary health care from puberty through menopause. Content will focus on preventative, sexual, and reproductive health care. Principles of pharmacology, pathophysiology, health promotion, and cultural considerations are integrated throughout the course.
prerequisites: NRSG 544D or equivalent transfer credit as co-requisite. Students must enroll in NRSG 544D first.
sections: Class Nbr: 5275, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ONLIN, Meets: Meets Online, Instructor: Staff, Status: Open
